mdRecord.dcterms:title: Map of the vicinity of Richmond / made under the direction of Capt. A.H. Campbell, ., Chief of Topographical Dept. ; Ch'f Engineer's Office D.N.V., Col. J.F. Gilmer, Ch'f. Eng'r
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Campbell, Albert H. (Albert Henry), 1826-1899
Confederate States of America. Engineer Department
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Engineer Dept., Confederate States of America
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Shows woodlands, rivers, towns, and residents, with railroads, roads and a grid of the city of Richmond shown in red.
Covers the area from the Pamunkey River in the northeast to Varina in the south then west to Short Pump and Chesterfield Court House.
Handwritten following the title: "Approved March 21st 1863. Albert H. Campbell Capt. P. Engrs & Chf. Top. Dep. D.N.V." The map has been annotated in blue ink.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Deposit, William J. Cox, 4 East Cothwell St., Leesburg, VA, 1965 Jan. 8.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Landowners--Virginia--Henrico County--19th century--Maps.
Richmond (Va.)--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Maps.
